node.title: 'The fair thing to do' - Govt to increase payments to struggling families
node.description: Almost 350,000 families will get an extra $20 a week from April next year, lifting 6000 more children out of poverty, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says.

node.title: Christchurch mosque terrorist claims inhumane treatment in prison
node.description: The Christchurch mosque terrorist says he pleaded guilty to the murder of 51 people last year because of the inhumane and degrading treatment he experienced while awaiting his trial.

node.title: Sydney Airport board agrees to $23.6bn takeover deal with international consortium
node.description: Australia's biggest and busiest airport could soon be changing hands, under a $23.6 billion takeover bid announced to the ASX this morning.

node.title: How No Time To Die could hint towards the next James Bond
node.description: The final James Bond film starring Daniel Craig as 007 comes out this week, ending one era and raising questions about where the franchise goes from here.

node.title: Trustpower reports solid profit gain on higher electricity generation
node.description: Trustpower's first half profit increased as it produced more power at higher prices, and gained from a rise in the value of its electricity hedges.

node.title: Linda Clark to head ACC client information and privacy review
node.description: The review follows the suspension of 14 ACC staff, after client information was shared and laughed at by ACC staff in a private Snapchat group.

node.title: Nurse who allegedly faked giving teenager COVID vaccine charged with fraud
node.description: A Perth nurse is arrested for vaccine fraud as police claim she pretended to give a teenager a COVID jab and then disposed of the dose, before allegedly falsifying the child's medical record.

node.title: Westpac commits $300m to sustainable investments
node.description: The investment arm of Westpac Bank NZ is committing up to $300m to sustainable investments that adhere to strict global standards.

node.title: Xero offers free counselling to business owners: 'It's an incredibly tough time'
node.description: Xero is offering free counselling sessions to more than 200,000 small business owners in Auckland over the strain of more than 80 days lockdown.

node.title: No sign of shark attack victim as search continues
node.description: There is still no sign of a man believed to have been taken by a shark at Port Beach in Western Australia on Saturday morning.

node.title: Sydney to further ease Covid-19 curbs as vaccinations pick up
node.description: Sydney will further ease social distancing curbs tomorrow, a month after emerging from a coronavirus lockdown that lasted nearly 100 days, as close to 90 percent of people have got both doses of…

node.title: Covid-19 pandemic driving a 'downgrading of social discourse', researcher says
node.description: The Delta outbreak has unleashed a greater willingness to use derogatory and offensive slurs as part of public discourse, according to a University of Auckland research fellow.

node.title: Woman's children harassed at work since lockdown charge laid, court hears
node.description: A woman accused of flouting Covid-19 restrictions by travelling to Auckland says her family has faced harassment since she was charged.

node.title: Universities hopeful international students can enter NZ next year
node.description: Universities say their foreign enrolments have remained "astonishingly high" and they are hoping international students can return to the country in the middle of next year.

node.title: Stanching the longest-running oil spill you've likely never heard of
node.description: In 2004, Hurricane Ivan brought down a massive oil platform operated by Taylor Energy, in the Gulf of Mexico. For years, oil has been seeping into the Gulf. Jon Wertheim reports on the efforts of a Coast Guard captain and a Cajun engineer to find a solution.

node.title: Missouri law prohibits local police from enforcing federal gun laws
node.description: A state law passed this past spring in Missouri makes local and state agencies susceptible to a $50,000 fine if they try to enforce federal gun laws.

node.title: Travis Scott and Drake sued over deadly crowd surge at Astroworld
node.description: The "mass casualty incident" occurred during Scott's performance on Friday night, authorities said.

node.title: She Died With Long Covid. Should Her Organs Have Been Donated?
node.description: Heidi Ferrer’s family feared her organs were unsafe. The case points to gaps in protocols for organ donation amid the pandemic.

node.title: Houston Officials Worried About Crowd Control Before Travis Scott Took the Stage
node.description: On the day of the show, the Houston police chief said that he visited Mr. Scott in his trailer and shared his concerns about the crowd.

node.title: Columbia, Cornell, Brown Hit By Bomb Threats, Evacuate Students
node.description: Two investigations are still ongoing and police have not yet linked any of the threats.

node.title: Joe Biden's Remarkable Week May Just Rescue His Presidency
node.description: A week ago Biden was staring into the abyss. By Saturday morning, the story was almost entirely different.

node.title: The ACT records 13 new COVID-19 cases, as 14 Canberra schools now listed as exposure sites
node.description: Fourteen school campuses are now listed as exposure sites in the territory as ACT Chief Minister Andrew Barr flags the next stage of eased restrictions could be brought forward.

node.title: Toowoomba Hospital visits restricted after COVID scare as Queensland records no new cases
node.description: Queensland records zero new COVID-19 cases as authorities call for more tests after several positive cases have been infectious in different parts of the state in recent days.

node.title: Madison de Rozario wins maiden New York Marathon
node.description: Madison de Rozario backs up her Tokyo Paralympic marathon victory with a maiden title at the New York Marathon.

node.title: Trump Attacks McConnell, House 'RINOs' Over Passage of 'Non-Infrastructure' Bill
node.description: "All Republicans who voted for Democrat longevity should be ashamed of themselves, in particular Mitch McConnell," the former president said.

node.title: Elon Musk puts fate of $US21 billion Tesla stocks on Twitter poll
node.description: The world's richest person asked Twitter whether he should offload 10 per cent of his Tesla holdings, with a majority of users on the social media platform voting for the sale.

node.title: Un desconocido parecía mi gemelo. Ese fue solo el comienzo
node.description: Un correo electrónico reveló un viejo secreto de mi familia, luego tuve que aprender a vivir con eso.

node.title: KiwiSaver third quarter returns relatively unaffected by lockdowns
node.description: KiwiSaver funds reflected subdued market conditions over the September quarter, with the bulk experiencing a return of less than one percent.

node.title: Police continue hunt for missing Otago man
node.description: Police searching for a missing Central Otago man have been re-enacting his last known movements this morning.

node.title: Bomb threats called into multiple Ivy League universities
node.description: It is not clear if the threats are connected, and no suspect has been publicly connected to any of the calls.

node.title: Travis Scott Sued by Astroworld Attendee Over 'Predictable' Harm, 'Encouragement of Violence'
node.description: "They consciously ignored the extreme risks of harm to concertgoers," wrote attorney Steve Kherkher in a suit filed Saturday.

node.title: Virginia Lawmaker Praises Northam-Youngkin Governor Transition Meeting in Dig at Trump
node.description: "They didn't lie. They didn't try to cheat. They didn't try to overturn results. They didn't incite violence. That's how democracy is supposed to work," Don Beyer wrote Sunday.

node.title: Police make further arrests over death of Christchurch teenager
node.description: Police have arrested more people in relation to the fatal shooting of of Christchurch teenager Connor Whitehead on Friday.

node.title: What we know about the victims of the Astroworld Festival tragedy
node.description: One of the victims was a high school freshman, authorities said.

node.title: Umpire tells unruly fans to 'go for a walk' as Novak Djokovic claims Paris Masters
node.description: Novak Djokovic wins the Paris Masters, his record-breaking 37th Masters title, with a battling three-set victory over world number two Daniil Medvedev.

node.title: Melbourne's touchless revolution is coming — and it's starting with crossing buttons
node.description: Touchless crossing buttons are being trialled across Melbourne in response to the COVID-19 pandemic, with hope to roll them out across the thousands of pedestrian crossings in Victoria.

node.title: SpaceX crew using incontinence pants on return to Earth after toilet breaks
node.description: The astronauts departing the International Space Station will be stuck using incontinence pants on the way home because of their capsule's broken toilet.

node.title: Skipper missing, four others rescued after boat capsizes in WA's north
node.description: A man in his 50s is missing but four of his passengers including two girls are found safe and well walking through marshland after their boat overturns near Derby in WA.

node.title: Ko wins in Saudi Arabia
node.description: New Zealand golfer Lydia Ko fired a final round of 65 to triumph by five shots at the Saudi Ladies International in Jeddah.

node.title: Victoria records 1,126 new COVID-19 cases and five deaths
node.description: There are now 16,178 active cases of the virus in Victoria, and 366 people have died during the current Delta outbreak.

node.title: Briscoe Group sales remain stable despite lockdowns
node.description: Briscoe Group says third quarter sales have delivered a solid result, despite the impact of ongoing lockdowns.

node.title: Fears Covid-19 cases will surpass 1000 a day by Christmas if restrictions eased
node.description: The government is being urged to put the brakes on letting Aucklanders hit the shops this week, with one expert saying the outbreak could "explode and spin out of control".

node.title: Aucklanders tired of lockdown: 'It's dragged on a lot'
node.description: It is day 83 of lockdown for Aucklanders, and many feel that rising case numbers will overshadow any reprieve in restrictions this week.

node.title: Terry Bradshaw Rips Aaron Rodgers Over COVID Fiasco: 'You Lied to Everyone'
node.description: "Unfortunately, we've got players that pretty much think only about themselves," the Pittsburgh Steelers legend said.

node.title: West Ham stun Liverpool to show top four credentials
node.description: Fans are delighted as West Ham United defeats Liverpool 3-2 at London Stadium to move into third spot on the English Premier League ladder.

node.title: COVID-19 vaccine booster program begins today
node.description: Australia's booster vaccination program begins today, meaning anyone over 18 who received their second dose of a COVID-19 vaccine at least six months ago — May 8 — can book to have a third shot.

node.title: Ron Klein Says Voters 'Sent a Message' Tuesday, Congress Responded With Infrastructure Bill
node.description: "[Americans] are in a 'show me, don't tell me' mode. I think we are going to show them in the weeks and months ahead that we have made this progress on COVID." said Biden's chief of staff.

node.title: Wallabies lose tight Test to Scotland after controversial decision
node.description: Disappointment as Wallabies lose third consecutive match against Scotland with Dave Rennie bemoaning a harsh call to deny Michael Hooper a first half try.

node.title: 14yo who spent 'weeks' in confined detention centre cell allowed to return home
node.description: A Kimberley boy who is believed to have spent "weeks at a time" in a confined cell at Western Australia's only juvenile detention facility is released.

node.title: Couple's newly built family home so defective experts recommend it be demolished
node.description: A couple's dream to build a home for their blended family on a waterfront block has been shattered, with experts advising the only way to fix the building's defects is to demolish it and rebuild.

node.title: Black Caps into semi-finals at T20 World Cup
node.description: New Zealand crushed a billion Indian dreams and breezed into the semi-finals of the Twenty20 World Cup with an eight-wicket victory against Afghanistan.

node.title: Your Monday Briefing
node.description: China’s new official history.

node.title: NYC Top Cop Warns More Guns on Street 'Last Thing We Need' as SCOTUS Mulls Permit Law
node.description: Commissioner Dermot Shea said striking down New York's law "would really open the floodgates in terms of people being able to carry guns across the city."

node.title: Fights Erupt at Boston Rally Against Masks, Vaccines as Brass Band Joins Counter-Protestors
node.description: The group responsible for the event previously organized a "Straight Pride" parade and a fundraiser for Jan. 6 rioters.

node.title: Founding member of reggae pop band UB40, Astro, dies after short illness
node.description: Terence Wilson, who went by the stage name Astro for UB40, rose to fame in the 1980s with hits like Red Red Wine and Can't Help Falling In Love.

node.title: A climate change success story to remember amid the gloom of COP26
node.description: As COP26 enters its second week without much sign of progress, despair is in the air. But before you give up all hope, there is a shining example of a global climate agreement that actually succeeded.

node.title: Today's sports news: What you need to know
node.description: In today's sports news - Venus wins in Paris, Hammers beat Liverpool and Scotland beat Wallabies.

node.title: More Americans Oppose Joe Biden than Donald Trump Running in 2024: Poll
node.description: Nearly two-thirds of Americans don't want Biden to seek another term in the next presidential election, according to a poll released Sunday.
